_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

Five factors for an anointed aristocrati: Well born on both his mother’s and father’s side, of pure descent, irrefutable and impeccable in questions of ancestry back to the seventh paternal generation
Attractive, good-looking, lovely, of surpassing beauty
Dear and beloved to his parents
Dear and beloved to the people of town and country
Trained and skilled in the arts of anointed aristocratic kings, such as elephant riding, horse riding, driving a chariot, archery, and swordsmanship
Five qualities for a mendicant to aspire: Faith in the Realized One’s awakening
Rarely ill or unwell, with a well-digesting stomach fit for meditation
Not devious or deceitful, revealing themselves honestly to the Teacher or sensible spiritual companions
Living with energy roused up for giving up unskillful qualities and embracing skillful qualities
Possessing the wisdom of arising and passing away which is noble, penetrative, and leads to the complete ending of suffering
